isis.stitle: CAB: 4100, 4200, 4300 AND 4400 MODELS - REMOVE - CAB DOOR TRIM PANEL

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models

figure.caption: Figure 52. Front Cab Door Trim Panel Fasteners

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 52 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two torx head screws (Item 1, view arrow A) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2, view arrow A) from the front cab door trim panel (Item 3, view arrow A), driver side shown.
Remove two torx head screws (Item 4) recessed in map pocket (Item 5) of front cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

Using a small blunt screwdriver (Item 6, view arrow B), push the center portion in slightly until they click, on each of the eight push-in fasteners (Item 7, view arrow B). Remove each push-in fastener from front cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

note.para: If the center of the push-in fasteners (Item 7) is pushed in too far, the center portion will fall inside the front cab door. Once the front cab door trim panel (Item 3) is removed from the front cab door, the center portion of the push-in fasteners can be retrieved, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 53 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift front cab door trim panel (Item 1) up and away from front cab door (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 53. Front Cab Door Trim Panel

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 54 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the front cab door trim panel (Item 1) being held away from the front cab door (Item 2), disconnect electrical connectors (Item 3) from electric window and door lock switch (Item 4). If so equipped, disconnect electrical connector (Item 5) from electric mirror switch. Lay front cab door trim panel on a padded surface and save for installation, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 54. Front Cab Door Trim Panel Electrical Connectors

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door trim panel with electric door window and locks.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Front Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Standard Cab, Extended Cab and Crew Cab for all Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 55 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove two torx head screws (Item 1, view arrow A) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2, view arrow A) from the front cab door trim panel (Item 3, view arrow A), driver side shown.
Remove two torx head screws (Item 4) recessed in map pocket (Item 5) of front cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

Push front cab door trim panel (Item 1, Figure 60)
in at the window regulator handle shaft. Using the proper removal tool, remove retaining clip (Item 13, Figure 60)
securing window regulator handle (Item 6) to the window regulator handle shaft. Remove window regulator handle from window regulator handle shaft. Lay retaining clip and window regulator handle out of the way and save for installation, driver side shown.

Using a small blunt screwdriver (Item 7, view arrow B), push the center portion in slightly until they click, on each of the eight push-in fasteners (Item 8, view arrow B). Remove each push-in fastener from front cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

note.para: If the center of the push-in fasteners (Item 8) are pushed in to far, the center portion will fall inside the front cab door. Once the front cab door trim panel (Item 3) is removed from the front cab door, the center portion of the push-in fasteners can be retrieved, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 55. Front Cab Door Trim Panel Fasteners and Window Regulator Handle

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 53
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift front cab door trim panel (Item 1) up and away from front cab door (Item 2). Lay front cab door trim panel on a padded surface to protect painted surfaces and save for installation, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side front cab door trim panel with manual door window and locks.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Crew Cab Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Electric Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for all Models

figure.caption: Figure 56. Rear Cab Door Trim Panel Fasteners

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 56 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove two torx head screws (Item 1, view arrow A) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2, view arrow A) from the rear cab door trim panel (Item 3, view arrow A), driver side shown.
Remove two torx head screws (Item 4) recessed in map pocket (Item 5) of rear cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

Using a small blunt screwdriver (Item 6, view arrow B), push the center portion in slightly until they click, on each of the eight push-in fasteners (Item 7, view arrow B). Remove each push-in fastener from rear cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

note.para: If the center of the push-in fasteners (Item 7) is pushed in too far, the center portion will fall inside the rear cab door. Once the rear cab door trim panel (Item 3) is removed from the rear cab door, the center portion of the push-in fasteners can be retrieved, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 57 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift rear cab door trim panel (Item 1) up and away from rear cab door (Item 2), driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 57. Rear Cab Door Trim Panel

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 58 for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: With the rear cab door trim panel (Item 1) being held away from the rear cab door (Item 2), disconnect electrical connectors (Item 3) from electric window and door lock switch (Item 4). Lay rear cab door trim panel on a padded surface and save for installation, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Rear Cab Door Trim Panel Electrical Connectors

calloutgroup.callout1: 4. ELECTRIC WINDOW AND DOOR LOCK SWITCH

step1.para: Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear cab door trim panel with electric door window and locks, driver side shown.

svcsubproc.title: Remove Crew Cab Rear Cab Door Trim Panel with Manual Door Window and Locks on Crew Cab for all Models
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 59 for Items in parentheses unless otherwise noted.

step1.para: Remove two torx head screws (Item 1, view arrow A) and remove inner door pull cup (Item 2, view arrow A) from the rear cab door trim panel (Item 3, view arrow A), driver side shown.
Remove two torx head screws (Item 4) recessed in map pocket (Item 5) of rear cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

Push rear cab door trim panel (Item 1, Figure 61)
in at the window regulator handle shaft. Using the proper removal tool, remove retaining clip (Item 13, Figure 61)
securing window regulator handle (Item 6) to the window regulator handle shaft. Remove window regulator handle from window regulator handle shaft. Lay retaining clip and window regulator handle out of the way and save for installation, driver side shown.

Using a small blunt screwdriver (Item 7, view arrow B), push the center portion in slightly until they click, on each of the eight push-in fasteners (Item 8, view arrow B). Remove each push-in fastener from rear cab door trim panel (Item 3), driver side shown.

note.para: If the center of the push-in fasteners (Item 8) are pushed in to far, the center portion will fall inside the rear cab door. Once the rear cab door trim panel (Item 3) is removed from the rear cab door, the center portion of the push-in fasteners can be retrieved, driver side shown.

figure.caption: Figure 59. Rear Cab Door Trim Panel Fasteners and Window Regulator Handle

svcsubproc.para:
Refer to Figure 57
for Items in parentheses.

step1.para: Lift rear cab door trim panel (Item 1) up and away from rear cab door (Item 2). Lay rear cab door trim panel on a padded surface to protect painted surfaces and save for installation, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure to remove passenger side rear cab door trim panel with manual door window and locks.
